meta.description: Relative/participial clauses; linking devices; comma & colon/semicolon; parallelism.

questions.question: Choose the correct defining relative clause:
choices: The book which I borrowed it was fascinating.
The book that I borrowed was fascinating.
The book, that I borrowed, was fascinating.
questions.explanation: Defining relative: no commas; no resumptive pronoun.

questions.question: Insert a suitable linker: "She studied hard; ____ , she topped the class." ____
Which sentence uses the semicolon correctly?
choices: I finished the essay; and I submitted it.
I finished the essay; I submitted it before midnight.
I finished the essay: I submitted it.
I finished the essay, I submitted it.
questions.explanation: Semicolon joins two related independent clauses.

questions.question: Combine using a participial clause: "He opened the window. He let in some fresh air."
answer: Opening the window, he let in some fresh air.
He opened the window, letting in some fresh air.
